title: Vintage Electric Fans
description: Before air conditioning, the electric fan was king. How well do you remember these cooling companions?

questions.question: What type of fan, mounted to the ceiling with wide blades, circulated air in living rooms and on covered porches?
What was the name for the feature on oscillating fans that made them slowly turn from side to side?
What classic American fan brand, known for heavy metal construction and art deco styling, became highly collectible?
What dangerous feature of early electric fans, before safety regulations, left the spinning blades fully exposed?
What type of fan, square-shaped and designed to sit on the floor or in a window, was a summer staple in bedrooms?
What large fan was installed in the attic or top-floor hallway to draw hot air out of the entire house?
What material were the blades of most vintage desk fans made from in the 1930s through 1950s?
What type of portable fan sat on a tall adjustable stand, typically in a living room corner?
What small fan was commonly found clipped to a desk or table in offices before air conditioning was widespread?
What did many people place in front of a fan to create a makeshift air conditioner?
options: A bowl or pan of ice

questions.question: What kitchen appliance fan, mounted above the stove, was designed to pull cooking smoke and odors out of the kitchen?
What was the typical number of speed settings on a classic oscillating fan?
What brand, founded in 1886, became one of America's oldest and most respected manufacturers of ceiling fans?
What humming or whirring sound from a bedside fan did many people come to rely on for help falling asleep?
What reversible feature on ceiling fans allowed them to push warm air down from the ceiling in winter?
options: A reverse switch to change blade direction
